content: Hello, I have been using Backdrop for a couple projects now. I personally use the (entity) reference module on all of my projects and it would be nice for me to have it in the core. So, I would like to know the current status of implementing the reference module and if there is anyone working on it.

Hi, Phinitnan Chanasabaeng. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

Hi @Phinitnan Chanasabaeng! According to this issue it seems that the desire is to get the Reference module stable in contrib and then move it into core. If you'd like to help out, I'd suggest starting in the Reference issue queue and making PRs for any open issues.

[D8] Add reference(s) module to core · Issue #1301 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I use node and user references all the time. It would be great if we could add these to core. See also: #51 Though that issue is currently slated for 2.x, I think we can add node and user reference...
backdrop-contrib/reference
Defines a field to allow Backdrop entities to reference each other. - backdrop-contrib/reference

@Phinitnan Chanasabaeng - Commenting in the issue queue can be an effective way to stimulate interest in an issue. However, this is a big issue so it's hard to say. The other thing you can do is show up at one of our weekly DEV meetings. This is a good place to gauge interest in an issue or get people interested in it.

I think this is an issue that just needs someone to start working on it and it will get traction. I think there is a lot of interest in getting it into core, we just need someone to get the issue moving.

IIRC, the last person actively working on #1301 hence with the most context was @Mike McCaffrey

[D8] Add reference(s) module to core · Issue #1301 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
I use node and user references all the time. It would be great if we could add these to core. See also: #51 Though that issue is currently slated for 2.x, I think we can add node and user reference...
@BWPanda Thanks for the reference. I will look at them to see what I can do.
@StPaulTim Joining the weekly meeting sounds interesting. will do.

Hey folks, the reference module is mostly done in terms of functionality, and should work for almost all your needs. The two things that are missing before it can get included in core are tests, and migration paths from other modules. I have found it impossible to get help working on those, though I have not tried to organize anything recently.

@Mike McCaffrey Thanks for your work on that! If its ready for use, do you think you can update the README then? Maybe use the recommended contrib format, and either add yourself as a maintainer or state that the project is looking for maintainers.

There are migration paths from reference, entity_reference, and term_reference in a PR. I expect those may need to be split into separate PRs to revise and commit each when ready, but we've got a pretty good starting point.
@Phinitnan Chanasabaeng I would love to help facilitate getting References into core! It's been on the Backdrop product roadmap several times but we could never push it to completion.

The challenge has been to maintain the current functionality of both References and Entity References (if both are being deprecated) and other related modules. And ensure access control keeps working the same
@quicksketch I'm appreciated. There is still a lot of things for me to learn before I can do any real work. I will keep you posted.

@Joseph Flatt FYI - Here is a topic from the last Backdrop LIVE about reference module in core.

I know that several of us spent about 45 minutes talking about this and I thought there were notes from that discussion, but I can't find them anywhere. @jenlampton @quicksketch do either of you know if those notes are still available.?

We should put a link in the github issue to the Google Doc (if there is one).
I don't think I was in that discussion

@Crackerizer I am the current maintainer for reference, and am using it on a handful of production sites. I would welcome help, and could even make you a co-maintianer if you are interested :) Once we have a stable project with an upgrade path, we can suggest it for core inclusion :)

@jenlampton Tim brought this up because I told him I wanted to work on https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1301. I have started working on some PRs and i have one up there already.

Ah, sorry. I must have mis-read the backscroll!
@jenlampton I would love to help maintain the module. Let me start working on some bugs/improvements to be familiar with how the module works.
